message.content:
We first need to determine the “accounts receivable” part of the balance‐sheet. In our books the only “customer receivables” come from sales for which the “receive_method” is “Account Receviable” (that is, sales that were not paid in cash immediately). (Note that “Interest Receivables” normally is a separate balance‐sheet item.) Also, since no opening balance was given for customer receivables (“Initial” rows are used to record deposits and fixed assets, not AR), we assume the AR balance was zero at the start.

Step 1. Identify the sale transactions with receive_method = “Account Receviable”. From the given table the following Sale rows qualify (with the “amount” field shown):

 • Sale20240102001: 284,230.98  
 • Sale20240102002: 274,894.93  
 • Sale20240103004: 287,021.71  
 • Sale20240106006: 180,661.23  
 • Sale20240107008: 2,041.74  
 • Sale20240110012: 1,925.47  
 • Sale20240110013: 295,859.81  
 • Sale20240111015: 2,212.39  
 • Sale20240111016: 277,286.94  
 • Sale20240112018: 13,759.13  
 • Sale20240123031: 2,384.14  
 • Sale20240128037: 241,259.43  
 • Sale20240128038: 264,938.80  
 • Sale20240130040: 216,405.22  
 • Sale20240130041: 272,245.21  
 • Sale20240130042: 2,313.08  
 • Sale20240131044: 241,168.27  
 • Sale20240205052: 41,527.91

Step 2. Sum these amounts:

 – Sum 1: 284,230.98 + 274,894.93 = 559,125.91  
 – Add 287,021.71 → 846,147.62  
 – Add 180,661.23 → 1,026,808.85  
 – Add 2,041.74 → 1,028,850.59  
 – Add 1,925.47 → 1,030,776.06  
 – Add 295,859.81 → 1,326,635.87  
 – Add 2,212.39 → 1,328,848.26  
 – Add 277,286.94 → 1,606,135.20  
 – Add 13,759.13 → 1,619,894.33  
 – Add 2,384.14 → 1,622,278.47  
 – Add 241,259.43 → 1,863,537.90  
 – Add 264,938.80 → 2,128,476.70  
 – Add 216,405.22 → 2,344,881.92  
 – Add 272,245.21 → 2,617,127.13  
 – Add 2,313.08 → 2,619,440.21  
 – Add 241,168.27 → 2,860,608.48  
 – Add 41,527.91 → 2,902,136.39  

Thus the sum of all “Account Receviable” sale amounts is 2,902,136.39.

Step 3. Since there was no initial "Accounts Receivable" balance (none of the “Initial…” entries are customer receivables), the AR at the beginning is 0.00. Then as a result of the sales made on account, the final (ending) AR balance becomes 2,902,136.39.

The final answer is therefore:

{
  "solution": {
    "Accounts Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Accounts Receivable End Value": "2902136.39"
  }
}
